meanings.definition: The state of being empty or without contents.
meanings.sent1: The voidnesses of the jar made it easy to see through.
meanings.sent2: The room's voidnesses were eerie in the darkness.
meanings.sent3: The voidnesses of the fridge were so extreme that even the light couldn't find anything inside.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a deep voidnesses that seemed to swallow all light.
meanings.sent5: The voidnesses of the abandoned house echoed with emptiness.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ineffective or useless.
meanings.sent1: The voidnesses of the plan became apparent when nothing went as expected.
meanings.sent2: The voidnesses of his promises left her feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The voidnesses of the broken umbrella made it more of a hindrance than a help.
meanings.sent4: The voidnesses of his words rang hollow in her ears.
meanings.sent5: The voidnesses of the old machine rendered it completely useless.
